settings.heading: Work & Offroad Ready: Upgrading Your Ford F-350 with LED Offroad Lights
settings.rich_text:
FORD F350 LED Lighting Outfitting Guide

Published: March 27th, 2024

settings.heading: MEET TEAM GENRIGHT:
settings.rich_text:
The GenRight race team features Jordan Pellegrino, a true Southern California native whose off-road adventure began in the vast expanse of the Mojave desert at the tender age of 5. Born into a family passionate about off-road racing, Jordan's journey has taken him from dirt bikes to four-wheelers, eventually propelling him into the thrilling world of King of the Hammers (KOH) racing.

Early Beginnings: Growing up as the son of Tony Pellegrino, the visionary founder of GenRight Off Road, Jordan's upbringing was immersed in the exhilarating world of off-road exploration. Under his father's guidance, he kicked up dust on dirt bikes before making the switch to four wheels at the young age of 8, cruising through the challenging terrain with a Trophy Cart.

Racing Passion: Fast forward to the present, and at 25 years old, Jordan Pellegrino has become a formidable force in the off-road racing scene, with a remarkable 10-year journey in KOH racing. What started as a childhood passion has evolved into a full-fledged career, showcasing his skills, determination, and love for the sport.

Educational Pursuits: Not just a racer, Jordan has honed his technical expertise by graduating from The Fab School. Armed with knowledge and skills, he has taken on the challenge of designing and building his own off-road vehicles, adding an extra layer to his impressive repertoire.

GenRight Off Road Legacy: At the heart of Jordan's off-road endeavors is GenRight Off Road, a renowned racing team that traces its roots back to Tony Pellegrino. For Tony, the desire for speed is as strong as ever, fueled by an unwavering passion for tinkering, building, and modifying. The legacy of GenRight continues to thrive, with Jordan contributing to its success and taking the family tradition to new heights.

Conclusion: Jordan Pellegrino's journey from dirt bike rides in the Mojave desert to the challenging terrains of KOH racing is a testament to his dedication, skill, and love for off-road adventure. With Off Road as their foundation, the GenRight story is one of passion, perseverance, and the pursuit of off-road racing glory.

settings.text:
Performance Race Spec Lighting Setup

GENRIGHT RACE TEAM
LED LIGHTING SETUP

The GenRight race team setup is clever and unique, equipped with a single Selective Yellow 6.7" CG2 Multi-LED Light Cannon, two 4.7" CG2 Multi-LED Light Cannons and vertical mounted UNITE Light Bars. The GenRight race rig sports over 75,000 lumens in just pod lights alone! The Vertical UNITE Light Bars are full selective yellow, combined the customized modular 50" Roof Bar there is no terrain or driving condition that they can't handle.

settings.subheading:
GENRIGHT RACE TEAM
FULL BUILD SPECS

Designed by Dobry, Built by Jordan. Together, they've created a high-performance off-road racecar that's turning heads. This beast is equipped with 4-wheel drive, 4-wheel independent suspension, and high ground clearance portals, ensuring it dominates any terrain it encounters. Under the hood roars the RHS tall LS block, a 454 cubic inch engine generating a jaw-dropping 805 horsepower. This powerhouse propels the car with unmatched force. Competing in the Ultra4 4400 Unlimited Class and Class 1 Desert racecar categories, this off-road machine is set to conquer the toughest challenges out there.

Team GenRight
RACE SCHEDULE & HISTORY

2024 Schedule:
Jan 25- Feb 4, 2024 –King of the Hammers
September 21, 2024 – PCI 300 Desert Race

Years Racing: GenRight has been racing the unlimited class at King of the Hammers (KOH) since 2010. King of the Hammers is the toughest single day race in the world. 2024 will be Jordan’s tenth time racing KOH.
